concepts.concept_name: Understanding place value up to ten lakhs (1,000,000)
Reading and writing numbers in Indian and international systems
Comparison and ordering of large numbers
Expanded form and short form of numbers
Face value and place value concepts

in_scope: Indian place value system (ones, tens, hundreds, thousands, ten thousands, lakhs, ten lakhs)
International place value system (ones through millions)

concepts.concept_name: Concepts of even and odd numbers
Reading and writing Roman numerals up to MMMCMXC (3,990)
Converting between Hindu-Arabic and Roman numerals
Understanding symbol usage and subtraction principle

in_scope: Symbols: I, V, X, L, C, D, M
Subtraction rule (smaller before larger: IV, IX, XL, XC, CD, CM)

concepts.concept_name: Addition and subtraction of numbers up to 10 lakhs
Word problems involving addition and subtraction

in_scope: Addition of numbers up to 7 digits
Subtraction of numbers up to 7 digits
Commutative property: a + b = b + a
Associative property: (a + b) + c = a + (b + c)
Verification using subtraction for addition and vice versa

concepts.concept_name: Multiplication of numbers up to 5 digits by 3-digit numbers
Introduction to exponents (squares and cubes of small numbers)
Relationship between dividend, divisor, quotient, and remainder

in_scope: Word problems with single division operation
BODMAS: Brackets, Orders, Division, Multiplication, Addition, Subtraction

concepts.concept_name: Concept of fractions (proper, improper, mixed numbers)
Fraction notation and representation on number line
Comparing and ordering fractions with same and different denominators
Addition and subtraction of fractions (like and unlike denominators)
Multiplication of fractions by whole numbers

in_scope: Addition and subtraction of like fractions
Addition and subtraction of unlike fractions
Finding fraction of a given quantity

concepts.concept_name: Concept of decimals as fractions with denominator 10, 100, 1000
Place value in decimals (tenths, hundredths, thousandths)
Multiplication and division of decimals by whole numbers
Use of decimals in context of money and measurement

in_scope: Converting fractions with denominator 10, 100, 1000 to decimals

concepts.concept_name: Finding all factors of a given number
Finding first 10 multiples of a number

in_scope: Factor: divides exactly with no remainder
Multiple: product of number and counting number
First 10 multiples of numbers up to 20
Sieve method for finding primes up to 100

concepts.concept_name: Using divisibility rules in number problems

in_scope: Divisibility by 3: sum of digits divisible by 3
Divisibility by 4: last two digits divisible by 4
Divisibility by 6: divisible by both 2 and 3
Divisibility by 8: last three digits divisible by 8
Divisibility by 9: sum of digits divisible by 9

concepts.concept_name: Application of HCF and LCM in real-world situations
Word problems involving HCF and LCM

in_scope: Factor tree method for prime factorization
HCF × LCM = Product of two numbers
Word problems: grouping, distribution, time intervals

concepts.concept_name: Concept of negative numbers in real-life contexts (temperature, money, elevation)
Addition and subtraction with negative numbers (introductory level)
Simple word problems involving negative numbers

in_scope: Negative numbers as numbers less than zero
Real-life contexts: temperature below zero, debt, below sea level
Ordering integers from least to greatest
Simple addition: positive + negative, negative + positive

concepts.concept_name: Point, line, line segment, and ray
Naming conventions for lines and points
Interior and exterior of a figure

in_scope: Point as a location with no dimension
Line as infinite in both directions
Ray with one endpoint extending infinitely
Naming: Point P, Line AB or l, Segment AB, Ray AB

concepts.concept_name: Angles: concept, vertex, arms, interior and exterior
Types of angles: acute, right, obtuse, straight, reflex, complete
Pairs of angles: complementary and supplementary

in_scope: Angle formed by two rays with common endpoint

concepts.concept_name: Concept of polygons and their classification
Triangles: types (scalene, isosceles, equilateral) and properties
Quadrilaterals: types (rectangle, square, parallelogram, rhombus, trapezium)
Properties of rectangles, squares, and other quadrilaterals
Polygons: naming convention, number of sides and angles

in_scope: Polygon as closed figure with straight sides
Triangle (3 sides), quadrilateral (4), pentagon (5), hexagon (6), heptagon (7), octagon (8)
Rectangle: 4 right angles, opposite sides equal
Square: 4 right angles, all sides equal
Parallelogram: opposite sides parallel and equal
Rhombus: all sides equal, opposite angles equal
Trapezium: one pair of parallel sides

concepts.concept_name: Basic concept and terminology (center, radius, diameter, circumference)

in_scope: Radius: distance from center to any point on circle
Diameter: line through center touching two points (d = 2r)
Chord: line segment with both endpoints on circle

concepts.concept_name: Solids: cuboids, cubes, cylinders, spheres, cones

in_scope: Sphere: 1 curved surface, no edges, no vertices
Cone: 1 circular face, 1 curved surface, 1 vertex
Understanding nets (flat patterns that fold into 3D shapes)

concepts.concept_name: Metric units: mm, cm, m, km

in_scope: Addition and subtraction with unit conversion

concepts.concept_name: Reading and writing time (12-hour and 24-hour format)
Conversion of hours, minutes, and seconds
Leap years and simple date calculations

in_scope: Finding end time given start time and duration
Finding duration given start and end times

concepts.concept_name: Concept of area and square units
Word problems involving perimeter and area

in_scope: Same perimeter can have different areas
Same area can have different perimeters

concepts.concept_name: Concept of percentage as a fraction with denominator 100

in_scope: Percent to fraction: divide by 100, simplify

concepts.concept_name: Methods of collecting data: survey, questionnaire, observation

in_scope: Frequency: how often a value occurs

concepts.concept_name: Choosing appropriate graph for given data

in_scope: Pictographs with symbols representing multiple units
When to use which type of graph

concepts.concept_name: Reading information from tables and graphs
Median of a set of numbers
Simple problems involving mean, median, and mode

in_scope: Mean = sum of values / number of values
Median = middle value (when arranged in order)
Median for odd and even number of values
Finding mean, median, mode from small data sets
Finding the rule of a pattern

concepts.concept_name: Visual patterns in shapes and designs

metadata.source: ICSE Grade 5 Mathematics Syllabus 2025-2026 (Official CISCE Curriculum)
